abstract: Manhattan Federal Judge George B Daniels orders Palestinian Authority to post bond of $10 million and additional $1 million per month for duration of appeal of $655.5 million damages award in civil trial brought by families of American victims of terrorist attacks in Israel; ruling follows unusual 'statement of interest' by Justice Dept expressing concern for economic and political harm that high bond could cause to Palestinian Authority.
lead_paragraph: A judge also ruled that the group must pay an additional $1 million monthly to appeal a huge damages award for its role in six terrorist attacks in Israel that killed and injured Americans.

headline.main: Palestinian Authority Is Ordered to Post $10 Million Bond in Terror Case
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Authority Is Ordered to Post $10 Million Bond in Terror Suit

snippet: A judge also ruled that the group must pay an additional $1 million monthly to appeal a huge damages award for its role in six terrorist attacks in Israel that killed and injured Americans.
